org.opendaylight.controller.md.sal.binding.impl

Class ForwardedBindingDataBroker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.md.sal.binding.impl.AbstractForwardedDataBroker
      • org.opendaylight.controller.md.sal.binding.impl.ForwardedBindingDataBroker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.util.EventListener, BindingService, DataBroker, TransactionFactory, AsyncDataBroker<org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.InstanceIdentifier<?>,org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.DataObject,DataChangeListener>, AsyncDataTransactionFactory<org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.InstanceIdentifier<?>,org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.DataObject>, TransactionChainFactory<org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.InstanceIdentifier<?>,org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.DataObject>, BindingAwareService, DomForwardedBroker, org.opendaylight.yangtools.concepts.Delegator<DOMDataBroker>, org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.model.api.SchemaContextListener

    public class ForwardedBindingDataBroker
extends AbstractForwardedDataBroker
implements DataBroker
    The DataBrokerImpl simply defers to the DOMDataBroker for all its operations. All transactions and listener registrations are wrapped by the DataBrokerImpl to allow binding aware components to use the DataBroker transparently. Besides this the DataBrokerImpl and it's collaborators also cache data that is already transformed from the binding independent to binding aware format

        public ReadOnlyTransaction newReadOnlyTransaction()
        Description copied from interface: DataBroker
        Allocates a new read-only transaction which provides an immutable snapshot of the data tree.

        The view of data tree is an immutable snapshot of current data tree state when transaction was allocated.

      • newReadWriteTransaction

        public ReadWriteTransaction newReadWriteTransaction()
        Description copied from interface: DataBroker
        Allocates new read-write transaction which provides a mutable view of the data tree.

        Preconditions for mutation of data tree are captured from the snapshot of data tree state, when the transaction is allocated. If data was changed during transaction in an incompatible way then the commit of this transaction will fail. See AsyncWriteTransaction.commit() for more details about conflicting and not-conflicting changes and failure scenarios.

        Specified by:
        newReadWriteTransaction in interface DataBroker
        Specified by:
        newReadWriteTransaction in interface TransactionFactory
        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        new read-write transaction

      • newWriteOnlyTransaction

        public WriteTransaction newWriteOnlyTransaction()
        Description copied from interface: DataBroker
        Allocates new write-only transaction based on latest state of data tree.

        Preconditions for mutation of data tree are captured from the snapshot of data tree state, when the transaction is allocated. If data was changed during transaction in an incompatible way then the commit of this transaction will fail. See AsyncWriteTransaction.commit() for more details about conflicting and not-conflicting changes and failure scenarios.

        Since this transaction does not provide a view of the data it SHOULD BE used only by callers which are exclusive writers (exporters of data) to the subtree they modify. This prevents optimistic lock failures as described in AsyncWriteTransaction.commit().

        Exclusivity of writers to particular subtree SHOULD BE enforced by external locking mechanism.

        Specified by:
        newWriteOnlyTransaction in interface DataBroker
        Specified by:
        newWriteOnlyTransaction in interface TransactionFactory
        Specified by:
        newWriteOnlyTransaction in interface AsyncDataBroker<org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.InstanceIdentifier<?>,org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.DataObject,DataChangeListener>
        Specified by:
        newWriteOnlyTransaction in interface AsyncDataTransactionFactory<org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.InstanceIdentifier<?>,org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.DataObject>
        Returns:
        new write-only transaction

      • createTransactionChain

        public BindingTransactionChain createTransactionChain(TransactionChainListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: DataBroker
        Create a new transaction chain. The chain will be initialized to read from its backing datastore, with no outstanding transaction. Listener will be registered to handle chain-level events.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
